alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Pulaski; White (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 10:35AM EST until further notice by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Salamonie River below Warren affecting Huntington, Wells, Jay, Wabash and Blackford Counties. Tippecanoe River above Winamac affecting Carroll, Pulaski and White Counties. Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Wells and Adams Counties. Eel River at North Manchester affecting Miami, Cass IN, Kosciusko, Wabash and Whitley Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Indiana... Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Marshall, Pulaski, Fulton IN, Kosciusko and Starke Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tippecanoe River above Winamac. * WHEN...From Saturday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Extensive residential flooding is in progress. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening and continue rising to a crest of 10.8 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
